oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Presbyterian Day Program of the Tennessee Exposition, 1897

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Programs
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.); Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cover of a program announcing "Presbyterian Day" on October 28, 1897, at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition. The center of the program features an image of a log cabin, and each corner of the program has the names of persons associated with the formation of Presbyterianism in early Tennessee. All the text and artwork is done in blue.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition Collection, 1895-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The four persons named on the front of the program were the "pioneers" of Presbyterianism in early Tennessee, including Rev. Charles Cummings (ca. 1746-1812) and Rev. Samuel Doak (1749-after 1818).
